job_title: Certified Medication Aide in West Bend, WI
pros: I have been at Cedar for quite a few years. I do enjoy working here.
cons: Healthcare is just hard right now.

review_title: Payroll Woman needs to be terminated
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Bend, WI
pros: There was nothing really positive about my experience here. It was always one bad thing after the last bad thing
cons: Payroll consistently screws up your paychecks and W2's. Huge staff turnover. Upper management terminates staff who have any type of opinion with a "if you don't like it, there's the door" attitude. Very unprofessional and quite honestly, sad , for the residents who have to adjust to new staff every few months.

job_title: Resident Assistant in West Bend, WI
pros: It’s a Great place to work
cons: Lots of time on your feet.

job_title: Registered Nurse in West Bend, WI
pros: Friendly coworkers and great nursing supervisors
cons: They work with minimal staff. It's hard to get your job done because they expect way too much from the floor staff. The patient to nurse ratio is unfair to the residents. Management does not take your complaints seriously.

job_title: Vice President, Facilities in West Bend, WI
cons: none, none, none, none, none (5 word minimum)
No real downsides to speak of.

review_title: Wonderful residents and staff, poor management.
job_title: Registered Nurse in West Bend, WI
pros:
Cedar Community has many different divisions and opportunities for growth.
Staff really care about each other and the residents.
Residents are appreciative of the care.
Beautiful campus surroundings.
cons:
Management pays lip service by asking for feedback from front line employees, but never makes the needed changes and instead tells staff why their ideas are wrong.
Management will make you choose between what is in the best interest of the resident or your job.
Limited resources and technology issues.
Management will criticize, not thank you, for going above and beyond.
High turnover.

pros: Lovely place. Good co - workers, family and volunteers. Benefits are pretty good as well. Enjoy my job.
cons: Communication to poor between Managers. Human Resources unfortunately has too many staff who do not have a degree in this area and have been given supervisor roles. We need staff who have been educated in this area and who we can go to and trust. Nursing Assistant pay needs to he higher,

pros: I really love my residents at CBE, CBW, Cottages, and The new one I worked with at Elkart Lake! They are like family to me which I think they have put in their years of hard work and giving up their independence to be spoiled and cared for like we would care for our parents! We work in their house not them bothering us in our work place! Respect , Trust and Love I do see most of the time but this is a area that can always improve! Cedar is a good company but all of us working together can make it a great company!
cons: People need to leave their problems with workers and home at the door when they punch in. The residents their family's and others don't need to hear it. If you don't have anything nice to say about anybody or to anybody don't say anything at all. This is their home respect that. Try being positive, happy, give a hug make someone smile that can be catchy and goes a long way and makes for a better work place one you can be proud of!

job_title: Registered Nurse in West Bend, WI
pros: There are a lot of growth opportunities at Cedar Community. In house training, tuition reimbursement and scholarships. In addition to the traditional benefits there is the use of the pool, exercise equipment, lake house, beach house, pontoon boat and hiking trails. I feel the management is very helpful in career direction.
cons: The Insurance package can be a little tricky now that there's a spousal surcharge. However, they do have an additional insurance package to choose from now - an HSA.

review_title: Cedar Community was the worst job of my life!!!
job_title: Dining Assistant in West Bend, WI
pros: I really enjoyed working with the residents who lived at the facility.  My supervisor was really great when It came to my school schedule.
cons: The place was always short staffed.  You never had enough time to help everyone.  You were always rushed.  2 our of my 3 supervisors were always crabby and hateful.  You could tell they didn't want to be bothered.  All of my co-workers didn't care about their job and I was sick of cleaning up after them.  The hourly pay was very poor at only $8.00 per hour.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in West Bend, WI
pros: If you're apart of the in crowd you're golden, if not you will be judged and kept out of the loop intentially.
cons: Under appreciated, severely under paid, constantly closing units, consistent lay offs, poor management, ethically bankrupt, does not put patient needs first especially for faith based organization.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in West Bend, WI
pros: Some of the nurses, cna's and huc's are nice to work with.
cons: Company more concerned about overtime and seems to care less about staffs overall wellbeing.

job_title: Financial Services Associate in West Bend, WI
pros: Small company with a big heart
cons: PTO/Vacation/Sick time package leave a LOT to be desired.
Short staffed, long hours, low wages
